overview_of_class: Students will explore Chicago's racial and ethnic make-up through the use of oral history storytelling techniques. The city's 77 neighborhoods such as Chatham, Lawndale, Pilsen and Uptown make up one of the most diverse, yet also one of most segregated cities in the U.S. This course examines that dichotomy by engaging with neighborhood residents and stakeholders and is open to Medill and non-Medill students. It may fulfill several diversity curricular requirements.
name: Chicago Speaks: Listening for Power and Place
title: JOUR JOUR 331-0-20 Chicago Speaks: Listening for Power and Place
